questions.text: Early in the episode there was a news report about people being afraid of Supergirl. What type of crime was she stopping in the video used with the report?
questions.explanation:
Bank robbery.

	People were still upset that Supergirl had attacked the city in the previous episode. The news footage showed a victim running away from Supergirl as she stopped the bank robbery.

questions.text: Kara took a sick day from work.
questions.explanation:
True.

	James ended up answering the phones in Cat's office. Cat thought it was unacceptable that Kara was taking the whole day off while she was sick. She had already missed nearly three hours, when she decided to take the full day. Cat thought that should have been enough.

questions.text: Crime rates had risen by how much since Supergirl had her run in with red Kryptonite?
questions.explanation:
40 percent.

	Cat mentioned it in her office while talking to Wynn and James. Cat was upset that the city wasn't forgiving Supergirl faster and even mentioned Mel Gibson rebounding after his public tirades.

questions.text: Lucy Lane returned in this episode; what job had she taken after leaving CatCo?
options: Reporter at the National City Tribune
questions.explanation:
U.S. Army Major

	She returned to the military, though it wasn't mentioned how she had managed to re-enlist.  She showed up in the DEO to interrogate every member of the post about who knew about the Martian Manhunter.

questions.text: Whose father did the Martian Manhunter save during a flashback?
questions.explanation:
Alex.

	He was also Kara's step-father. Jeremiah Danvers was played by Dean Cain, who had played Superman in "Lois & Clark: The News Adventures of Superman". The Martian saved his life momentarily, but Jeremiah ended up dying anyway, or so the Martian thought. It was later revealed that Jeremiah was being kept alive by Project Cadmus.

questions.text: Who killed the real Hank Henshaw?
questions.explanation:
Jeremiah Danvers.

	Henshaw had stabbed Danvers during their fight, so they essentially killed each other. Henshaw was thrown off a cliff. The story came out during the Martian Manhunter's interview with the Army officials.

questions.text: Where was Alex when "Hank" recruited her for the DEO?
questions.explanation:
In jail.

	The "Hank" that recruited her was actually the Martian Manhunter in disguise.  Alex had been arrested after an excessive night out partying at a club. The Martian Manhunter, disguised as Hank Henshaw, recruited Alex to work for him. He was just doing as Jeremiah Danvers had asked and protecting his daughters.

questions.text: Kara revealed her identity to Lucy.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After Alex was arrested she asked James to contact Lucy. When Lucy showed up at Kara's loft she revealed her identity and begged for help saving her sister before she was sent to Project Cadmus.

questions.text: What animal, that was at the beach, did Krypton not have?
questions.explanation:
Birds.

	In a flashback to when they were kids Kara told Alex that she was acting strange because they didn't have birds on her planet. That's when Kara heard screaming and ran off to save a woman and baby from a car crash. It was the first time she had saved anyone while on Earth.

questions.text: Who was named acting director of the DEO at the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Lucy Lane.

	Lucy turned to Supergirl and asked her to help her with the job. Lucy told Supergirl that if she could get her to trust her, then she could win back the people as well.
